001package imagingbook.common.util;
002
003import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;
004import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
005import java.io.IOException;
006import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
007import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
008import java.lang.reflect.Field;
009import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
010import java.util.ArrayList;
011import java.util.Base64;
012import java.util.List;
013
014/**
015 * Defines static methods for object copying and encoding to strings.
016 * 
017 * @author WB
018 * @version 2022/09/11
019 */
020public abstract class ObjectUtils {
021        
022        private ObjectUtils() {
023        }
024        
025        // https://stackoverflow.com/a/26000025
026        
027        /**
028         * Returns a shallow copy of the given object using reflection.
029         * This can be used if the {@link Cloneable} interface is not 
030         * (or cannot be) implemented.
031         * 
032         * @param <T> generic type
033         * @param entity the object to be copied
034         * @return the object copy
035         */
036        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
037        public static <T> T copy(T entity) {
038            Class<?> clazz = entity.getClass();
039//          T newEntity = (T) entity.getClass().newInstance();
040            T newEntity = null;
041                try {
042                        newEntity = (T) entity.getClass().getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
043                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException | InvocationTargetException
044                                | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) { }
045
046            while (clazz != null) {
047                copyFields(entity, newEntity, clazz);
048                clazz = clazz.getSuperclass();
049            }
050
051            return newEntity;
052        }
053
054        private static <T> T copyFields(T entity, T newEntity, Class<?> clazz) {
055            List<Field> fields = new ArrayList<>();
056            for (Field field : clazz.getDeclaredFields()) {
057                fields.add(field);
058            }
059            for (Field field : fields) {
060                field.setAccessible(true);
061                try {
062                                field.set(newEntity, field.get(entity));
063                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { }
064            }
065            return newEntity;
066        }
067        
068        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
069        
070        // adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/a/30968827
071        private static byte[] convertToBytes(Object object) {
072                ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
073            try (ObjectOutputStream out = new ObjectOutputStream(bos)) {
074                out.writeObject(object);
075                return bos.toByteArray();
076            } catch (IOException e) { }
077            return null;
078        }
079        
080        private static Object convertFromBytes(byte[] bytes) {
081                ByteArrayInputStream bis = new ByteArrayInputStream(bytes);
082            try (ObjectInputStream in = new ObjectInputStream(bis)) {
083                return in.readObject();
084            } catch (IOException | ClassNotFoundException e) { }
085            return null;
086        }
087        
088        
089        // TODO: check for null/exceptions
090        /**
091         * Serializes and encodes an arbitrary object to a string. This is potentially
092         * dangerous and only intended for local use, e.g., to define constant matrices
093         * with full precision. The string encoding is 'Base64' implemented with
094         * standard Java8 functionality. See {@link #decodeFromString(String)} for
095         * decoding.
096         * 
097         * @param object an arbitrary object
098         * @return the Base64 string encoding of the object
099         */
100        public static String encodeToString(Object object) {
101                byte[] ba = convertToBytes(object);
102                return Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(ba);
103        }
104        
105        // TODO: check for null/exceptions
106        /**
107         * Decodes and deserializes an object encoded with {@link #encodeToString(Object)}.
108         * The type of the encoded object must be known.
109         * 
110         * @param string the encoded object string
111         * @return the associated object (cast to the known type)
112         */
113        public static Object decodeFromString(String string) {
114                byte[] ba = Base64.getDecoder().decode(string);
115                return convertFromBytes(ba);
116        }
117
118}
